sourceDesc.p: This is the feature-file for defective feminine nouns.

revisionDesc.change: For EGY-___ there are no values found
updating references to Zotero IDs via update-bibl-refs.xsl

wib:featureValueObservation.note: "All through the area the scheme CVCCāy, representing old forms with -an (-ā), -āʔ, -āya is usual without a final vowel in the sedentary dialects (...) In Bedouin dialects, too, point 53: miṣfāya, miḏrāya, mrāya, ʕabāya, ḥkāya, furšāya, nṯāya, ġullāya. Such forms are also attested in other Bedouin dialects of the area." (p.267)

"All through the area the scheme CVCCāy, representing old forms with -an (-ā), -āʔ, -āya is usual without a final vowel in the sedentary dialects (...) In Bedouin dialects, too, point 53: miṣfāya, miḏrāya, mrāya, ʕabāya, ḥkāya, furšāya, nṯāya, ġullāya. Such forms are also attested in other Bedouin dialects of the area." (p.267)

only created for the gahawa

cit.note: It should be noted that the final a of ṣubāya is a long a and not a ta-marbūṭa

cit.quote: date of the kind daglat nour

wib:featureValueObservation.note: Deduced from examples.
